I ask him what time he normally gets up and he replies, unsmilingly, I get up at 4.30 or five and exercise generally and read the paper in the sauna. His way of life seems almost comically Spartan. Donald Rumsfeld also has several complaints about message. He contends it was a mistake for the administration, after finding no WMDs in Iraq, to shift to speaking more about implanting democracy as a rationale for the war. Condoleezza Rice seemed to be the one top advisor who spoke that way, he writes, "but it was not clear to me whether she was encouraging the Dick Cheney to use rhetoric about democracy or whether it was originating with the Dick Cheney ."
